name: attenuated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
weak or weaker: attenuated political reform a live, attenuated vaccine (= with a weaker virus)
long and thin or thinner: The figurines have long, attenuated necks. See
attenuate
More examplesFewer examplesThe lawyer accepted that his client has several connections to the terrorist, but he described them as attenuated. An attenuated market reduced private investor interest in our company.A vaccine can be made with an attenuated virus - a live virus that has been modified to delete the serious symptoms of the illness.The fibres had become attenuated.The racing cyclists have a lithe, attenuated look.
